user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtMem2HexFile:
```c
bool UtMem2HexFile(const void *Memory, const char *Filename, uint32 Length)
{
    FILE * fp;
    uint32 i;
    uint32 j;

    if ((fp = fopen(Filename, "w")))
    {
        for (i = 0; i < Length; i += 16)
        {
            fprintf(fp, "   %06lX: ", (unsigned long)i);
            for (j = 0; j < 16; j++)
            {
                if ((i + j) < Length)
                    fprintf(fp, "%02X ", ((uint8 *)Memory)[i + j]);
                else
                    fprintf(fp, "   ");
            }
            fprintf(fp, " ");
            for (j = 0; j < 16; j++)
            {
                if ((i + j) < Length)
                    fprintf(fp, "%c", isprint(((uint8 *)Memory)[i + j]) ? ((uint8 *)Memory)[i + j] : '.');
            }
            fprintf(fp, "\n");
        }
        fclose(fp);
        return true;
    }
    else
    {
        printf("UtMem2HexFile: Error Opening File: %s, %s\n", Filename, strerror(errno));
        UtAssert_True(false, "UtMem2HexFile: Error Opening File");
        return false;
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function UtMem2HexFile:
#define UtAssert_True(Expression, __VA_ARGS__) UtAssertEx(Expression,UtAssert_GetContext(),__FILE__,__LINE__,__VA_ARGS__)
...
UtAssert_CaseType_t UtAssert_GetContext(void)
{
    return DefaultContext;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
fclose(fp);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the call fclose(fp) invokes the C library function fclose, which does not call UtMem2HexFile (neither directly nor indirectly) in the provided code. A violation would only occur if fclose were redefined/wrapped so that it (or some function it calls) eventually called UtMem2HexFile, creating indirect recursion, but there is no evidence of that here.
